YEAST.NAME: CL-0670 Swiss Lager
YEAST.NOTES: A unique strain that has both a clean, crisp lager flavor and a soft, smooth maltiness. Perfect for European Pilsners. Like our CL-660 strain, this is an excellent all purpose Lager yeast for those wanting a fuller, rounder palate.

YEAST.NAME: 2042 Danish Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Rich, Dortmund style, with a crisp, dry finish. Soft profile accentuates hop flavor.

YEAST.NAME: WLP749 Assmanshausen Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: German red wine yeast, which results in spicy, fruit aromas. Perfect for Pinot Noir and Zinfandel. Slow to moderate fermenter which is cold tolerant. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%.

YEAST.NAME: WLP013 London Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Classic British Pale Ales, Bitters and Stouts
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, malty ale yeast. Produces a complex, oak flavored ester character. Hop bitterness comes through well.

YEAST.NAME: WLP650 Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sour ales and lambics (in secondary)
YEAST.NOTES: Medium intensity Brett character. Classic strain used in secondary fermentation for Belgian style beers and lambics. One Trappist brewery uses this strain in secondary fermentation.

YEAST.NAME: 2272 North American Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Pilsner, California Common, Canadian Lager, Oktoberfest, Marzen
YEAST.NOTES: American and Canadian lager yeast. Malty finish makes it suitable for Marzens/Oktoberfest as well.

YEAST.NAME: 1056 American Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Pale Ale, Scottish Ale, Porters, Sweet Stout, Barley Wine, Alt
YEAST.NOTES: Soft, smooth, clean finish. Very well balanced. Very versatile - works well with many ale styles.

YEAST.NAME: 1026 British Cask Ale
YEAST.NOTES: A great choice for any cask conditioned British Ale. Produces nice malt profile with a hint of fruit. Finishes dry and slightly tart.

YEAST.NAME: K-97 SafAle German Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: High attenuation ales, wheat beers and weizens.
YEAST.NOTES: Low sedimentation yeast, sometimes used in open fermentation. Good for wheat beers, weizens and light ales.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0650 Old Bavarian Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Well rounded, malty with a subtle ester complex and citrus flavors. Distinct, flavorful yeast is great for Southern German lager styles.

YEAST.NAME: WLP001 California Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Style Ales, Ambers, Pale Ales, Brown Ale, Strong Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Very clean flavor, balance and stability. Accentuates hop flavor versatile - can be used to make any style ale.

YEAST.NAME: WLP920 Old Bavarian Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bock and Dark Lagers.
YEAST.NOTES: Southern Germany/Bavarian lager yeast. Finishes malty with a slight ester profile.

YEAST.NAME: 1098 British Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All British Ales, Pales, Bitters, English Strong Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Fruity, tart, dry crisp finish. Very well balanced.

YEAST.NAME: WLP002 English Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English Pale Ale, ESB, India Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Porter, Sweet Stouts and Strong Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Classic ESB strain best for English style milds, bitters, porters and English style stouts. Leaves a clear beer with some residual sweetness.

YEAST.NAME: WLP051 California Ale V
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American style Pales, Ambers, Browns, IPAs, American Strong Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Similar to White Labs California Ale Yeast, but slightly lower attenuation leaves a fuller bodied beer.

YEAST.NAME: WLP033 Klassic Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bitters, milds, porters stouts and scottish ale styles.
YEAST.NOTES: Traditional English Ale style yeast. Produces ester character, and allows hop flavor through. Leaves a slightly sweet malt character in ales.

YEAST.NAME: 1087 Wyeast Ale Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of ale strains designed to provide quick starts, good flavor, balance and flocculation. Balanced finish suitable for most American and British ale styles.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0320 Belgian Ale #2
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Flanders style Belgian Ales, Belgian Brown, Fruit beers
YEAST.NOTES: Flanders style yeast. Strong fermenting yeast attenuates well and produces fruity, malty, estery malt profile. Slow to flocculate.

YEAST.NAME: 3711 French Saison
YEAST.BEST_FOR: French and Belgian Saison or Farmhouse ales
YEAST.NOTES: A very versatile strain that produces Saison or farmhouse style biers as well as other Belgian style beers that are highly aromatic (estery), peppery, spicy and citrusy. This strain enhances the use of spices and aroma hops, and is extremely attenuative.

YEAST.NAME: 2124 Bohemian Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsners, Pilsners, German Helles, Bocks
YEAST.NOTES: Ferments clean and malty, with rich malty flavor for full gravity pilsners.

YEAST.NAME: WLP885 Zurich Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Swiss style lager, and high gravity lagers (over 11% ABV)
YEAST.NOTES: Swiss style lager yeast. Sulfer and diacetyl production is minimal. May be used for high gravity lagers with proper care.

YEAST.NAME: WLP023 Burton Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All English styles including Pale Ale, IPA, Porter, Stout and Bitters.
YEAST.NOTES: Burton-on-trent yeast produces a complex character. Flavors include apple, pear, and clover honey.

YEAST.NAME: WLP568 Belgian Style Saison Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: This blend melds Belgian style ale and Saison strains. The strains work in harmony to create complex, fruity aromas and flavors. The blend of yeast strains encourages complete fermentation in a timely manner. Phenolic, spicy, earthy, and clove like flavor.

YEAST.NAME: WLP060 American Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: A blend that celebrates WLP001 (California Ale Yeast's) clean, neutral fermentation. This strain is versatile and adds two other yeast strains that are also clean/neutral in flavor to add a bit of complexity - almost a lager like finish.

YEAST.NAME: 2001 Urquell Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Pilsner Urquell yeast with mild fruit/floral aroma. Very dry and clean on palate with full mouth feel. Subtle malt character. Clean and neutral finish.

YEAST.NAME: WLP570 Belgian Golden Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Dubbel, Grand Cru, Belgian Holiday Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Combination of fruitiness and phenolic characters dominate the profile. Some sulfur which will dissipate following fermentation.

YEAST.NAME: WLP007 Dry English Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Pale Ales, Amber, ESB, Brown Ales, Strong Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, Highly flocculant, and highly attentive yeast. Similar to White labs English Ale yeast, but more attentive. Suitable for high gravity ales.

YEAST.NAME: CL-5200 Brettanomyces Lambicus
YEAST.NOTES: Wild yeast strain associated with Belgian breweries. Contributes horsey, old leather flavor complex to Belgian lambics. Slow growing yeast that takes weeks to ferment and months to develop fully.

YEAST.NAME: WLP775 English Cider Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Cider, Wine and High Gravity Beer
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Cider yeast. Ferments dry, but retains apple flavor. Some sulfer produced during fermentation will fade with age.

YEAST.NAME: 2278 Czech Pilsner Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian and American Pilsner, Bocks, Oktoberfest, Marzen
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Pilsner strain. Creates a dry but malty finish. Perfect for Pilsners and bocks. Some sulfur produced, but will fade with time.

YEAST.NAME: 1332 Northwest Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Oregon Ales, All American Ale styles
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Northwest US ale yeast. Slight fruit flavor, malty ale with good body and balance.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0920 German Wheat BT
YEAST.NOTES: Top fermenting Weizenbier yeast. Intensely spicy, clovey and phenolic. High attenuation.

YEAST.NAME: WLP550 Belgian Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Saisons, Belgian Reds, Belgian Browns, White beers
YEAST.NOTES: Phenolic and spicy flavors. Complex profile, with less fruitiness than White's Trappist Ale strain.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0260 Canadian Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Light Canadian Ales, Bitish Bitter, Pale Ale, Porters
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, strong fermenting, well attenuated ale yeast that leaves a pleasant, fruity, complex finish.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0050 California Pub Ale
YEAST.NOTES: For that classic U.S. small brewery flavor. CL-50 produces terrific American red & pale ale styles. While attenuation is normal, this yeast produces a big, soft, well rounded malt flavor that really lets caramel malt flavors shine.

YEAST.NAME: WLP566 Belgian Saison II Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Saison strain with a more fruity ester profile than WLP565 (Belgian Saison I Yeast). Moderately phenolic with a clove-like characteristic in finished beer flavor and aroma. Ferments quickly.

YEAST.NAME: 1187 Ringwood Ale
YEAST.NOTES: European ale yeast. Highly flocculant with complex, clear, but malty profile. Slightly fruity ester.

YEAST.NAME: 1275 Thames Valley Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British Bitters, ESB, India Pale Ale, English Strong Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, complex flavor. Low in fruit, low in esters, rich in flavor. Hops come through well.

YEAST.NAME: 3522 Belgian Ardennes
YEAST.NOTES: Phenolics develop at increased temperature. Mild fruitiness and complex spicy flavor.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0170 Classic British Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Complex ale with British tones and fruit like esters. Works well in high gravity ales such as scottish heavy as well.

YEAST.NAME: WLP041 Pacific Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English & American ales including milds, bitters, IPA, porters and English stouts.
YEAST.NOTES: Popular yeast from the Pacific Northwest. Leaves a clear and malty profile. More fruity than WLP002. Suitable for many English and American styles.

YEAST.NAME: WLP670 American Farmhouse Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Inspired by local American brewers crafting semi- traditional Belgian-style ales. This blend creates a complex flavor profile with a moderate level of sourness. It consists of a traditional farmhouse yeast strain and Brettanomyces. Great yeast for farmhouse styles.

YEAST.NAME: W-34/70 Saflager Lager
YEAST.NOTES: A famous yeast strain from Weihenstephan Germany used worldwide in brewing. Their most popular strain for lagers.

YEAST.NAME: WLP037 Yorkshire Square Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English pale ales, English brown ales and Mild ales
YEAST.NOTES: This yeast produces a malty but well balanced profile. Expect toasty flavors with malt driven esters. Highly flocculent and a good choice for many English ales.

YEAST.NAME: WLP802 Czech Budejovice Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Dry and crisp with low diacetyl production. From Southern Czech Republic.

YEAST.NAME: WLP540 Abbey IV Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Trappist Belgian Ales, Dubbels, Tripels and Specialty ales
YEAST.NOTES: An authentic Trappist style ale yeast. Use for Belgian ales including abbey ales (dubbels, tripels). Fruit character is medium - between WLP500 (high) and WLP530 (low).

YEAST.NAME: CL-0010 American Microbrewery Ale #1
YEAST.NOTES: Smooth, clean, strong fermenting ale yeast that works well at cold temperature. Clean malt flavor is ideal for cream ales.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0240 Irish Dry Stout
YEAST.NOTES: Top fermenting yeast which leaves a recognizable slightly woody character to Dry Stouts. Vinous almost lactic character that blends well with roast malts. High attenuation.

YEAST.NAME: WLP351 Bavarian Weizen Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Former yeast lab W51 strain. Produces a classic German style wheat beer with moderately high, spicy, phenolic overtones reminiscent of cloves.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0900 Belgian Wheat
YEAST.NOTES: Top fermenting yeast with a soft bread-like character. Leaves a sweet, mildly estery finish. Delicious Belgian character to any beer. Great in Wit style with coriander and bitter orange peel.

YEAST.NAME: 3056 Bavarian Wheat Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of top-fermenting ale and wheat yeasts providing a mild ester and phenolic profile.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0660 Northern German Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German pilsners, Mexican and Canadian Lagers
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, crisp, traditional lager character. Strong fermenting and forgiving yeast. Excellent general purpose lager yeast.

YEAST.NAME: WLP815 Belgian Lager Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, crisp European lager yeast with low sulfur production. The strain originates from a very old brewery in West Belgium. Great for European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers.

YEAST.NAME: WLP630 Berliner Weisse Blend
YEAST.NOTES: A blend of a traditional German Weizen yeast and Lactobacillus to create a subtle, tart, drinkable beer. Can take several months to develop tart character. Perfect for traditional Berliner Weisse.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0630 American Microbrewery Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Strong fermenter. Leaves a clean, full flavored, malty finish. Slightly attenuative. Versatile for most lager styles with a clean full flavor.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0200 Scottish Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Use for classic Scottish heavys, 90's- or strong ales. This yeast produces a soft, fruity malt profile with a subtle woody, oakey ester profile. A mild, mineral like dryness in the finish makes this a very complex strain.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0620 American Megabrewery
YEAST.NOTES: Smooth yeast with a slight fruity flavor. Lagers into a smooth, clean tasting beer. Use for light, clean lager styles with unobtrusive yeast character.

YEAST.NAME: S-189 SafLager German Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Wide range of lagers and pilsners.
YEAST.NOTES: Popular lager yeast strain. Produces wide range of continental lagers and pilsners. Clean finish.

YEAST.NAME: WLP090 San Diego Super Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: A super clean, super-fast fermenting strain. A low ester-producing strain that results in a balanced, neutral flavor and aroma profile. Alcohol-tolerant and very versatile for a wide variety of styles. Similar to California Ale Yeast WLP001 but it generally ferments faster.

YEAST.NAME: 4335 Lactobacillus Delbrueckii
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian gueze, lambic, sour brown ales, and Berliner Weisse.
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Produces mild acidity and sourness found in many types of Belgian beers. Always used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae and wild yeasts.

YEAST.NAME: 1450 Denny's Favorite 50
YEAST.NOTES: This terrific all-round yeast can be used for almost any beer style, and is a mainstay of one of our local homebrewers, Mr. Denny Conn. It is unique in that it produces a big mouthfeel and accentuates the malt, caramel, or fruit character of a beer without being sweet or under-attenuated.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0020 American Microbrewery Ale #2
YEAST.NOTES: Accentuated, rich, creamy malt profile. Generous amounts of diacytl. Use for low gravity beers where malt character is needed or stronger beers for a robust character.

YEAST.NAME: 1388 Belgian Strong Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Scottish Strong Ale,Trappist Ales, Dubbels, Trippels
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, tart, fruity flavor. High alcohol tolerance.

YEAST.NAME: WLP700 Flor Sherry Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: This yeast develops a film (flor) on the surface of the wine. Creates green almond, granny smith and nougat characteristics found in sherry. Can also be used for Port, Madeira and other sweet styles. For use in secondary fermentation. Slow fermentor.

YEAST.NAME: 3068 Weihenstephan Weizen
YEAST.NOTES: Unique Bavarian wheat yeast that produces the spicy weizen clove and banana flavor. Best when fermented at around 68 deg F.

YEAST.NAME: WLP760 Cabernet Red Wine Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc
YEAST.NOTES: High temperature tolerance. Moderate fermentation speed. Excellent for full-bodied red wines, ester production complements flavor. WLP760 is also suitable for Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%.

YEAST.NAME: 3638 Bavarian Wheat
YEAST.NOTES: Hefeweizen yeast with complex flavor and aroma. Bubble gum, banana flavors with apple/plum ester profile. Malty flavor.

YEAST.NAME: WLP006 Bedford British Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English style ales - bitter, pale, porter and brown ale
YEAST.NOTES: High attenuation. Ferments dry with high flocculation. Distinctive ester profile. Good for most English ale styles.

YEAST.NAME: 1762 Belgian Abbey II
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Trappist Ales, Abbey Ales, Grand Cru
YEAST.NOTES: Dry flavor with slight fruitiness. High alcohol tolerance.

YEAST.NAME: WLP515 Antwerp Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, almost lager like Belgian ale yeast. Good for Belgian pale and amber ales or with other Belgian yeasts in a blend. Biscuity, ale like aroma present. Hop flavors are accentuated. Slight sulfur during fermentation, and a lager like flavor profile.

YEAST.NAME: WLP740 Merlot Red Wine Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon
YEAST.NOTES: Neutral, low fusel alcohol production. Will ferment to dryness, alcohol tolerance to 18%. Vigorous fermenter. WLP740 is well suited for Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon. Alcohol Tolerance: 18%.

YEAST.NAME: S-04 SafAle English Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Fast starting, fast fermenting yeast. Quick attenuation helps to produce a clean, crisp, clear ale. Can be used in a wide range of ales.

YEAST.NAME: WLP677 Lactobacillus Bacteria
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Lambic, Berliner Weiss, Sour Brown and Gueze (secondary)
YEAST.NOTES: Bacteria for use in secondary. This lactic acid bacteria produces moderate levels of acidity and sour flavors found in lambics, Berliner Weiss, sour brown ale and gueze.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0690 California Esteem (Gold)
YEAST.BEST_FOR: California Common Beer, American or Robust porters
YEAST.NOTES: Use for California Common Beers (aka Steam Beer). Leaves a slightly estery, well attenuated finish. Quite distinct in flavor. Can also be used for complex porters.

YEAST.NAME: WLP565 Belgian Saison I Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Saison Ale, Belgian Ale, Dubbel, Trippel
YEAST.NOTES: Saison yeast from Wallonia. Earthy, spicy and peppery notes. Slightly sweet.

YEAST.NAME: WLP022 Essex Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British milds, pale ales, bitters, stouts.
YEAST.NOTES: Flavorful British yeast with a drier finish than many ale yeasts. Bready and fruity in character. Well suited for top cropping (collecting). Does not flocculate as much as WLP005 or WLP002.

YEAST.NAME: 1338 European Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: European Ales, German Ales, Alts, Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Kolsch
YEAST.NOTES: Very malty flavor characteristic of Bavarian/Munich Ales. Complex character.

YEAST.NAME: 71B-1122 Lalvin
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Young wines such as nouveau, blush and sugar white.
YEAST.NOTES: Rapid starter with constant and complete fermentation. Ability to metabolize high amounts (20-40%) of malic acid. Partial metabolism of malic acid helps soften the wine. May produce significant esters, making it a good choice for concentrates.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0980 American White Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Smooth wheat yeast with a round, clean, malt flavor. Low flocculation leaves cloudy Hefe-Weizen finish. Smooth flavor makes a great unfiltered wheat beer.

YEAST.NAME: WLP715 Champagne Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Can tolerate alcohol up to 17%. For Barley Wine or Meads.

YEAST.NAME: WLP320 American Hefeweizen Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Produces a much smaller amount of clove and banana flavor than the German Hefeweizen White Labs yeast. Some sulfur, and creates desired cloudy look.

YEAST.NAME: 3278 Belgian Lambic Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Lambic culture of Saccharomyces Cerevisiar and a mixture of yeasts and bacterias. Blend of organisms helps create lactic flavor of Belgian Lambics.

YEAST.NAME: RC-212 Lalvin
YEAST.NOTES: RC212 recommended for red variety wines and high gravity beers. Alcohol tolerance in the 12-14% range. Low foaming and moderate speed fermenting. Saccharomyces Cerevisiae.

YEAST.NAME: WLP800 Pilsner Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Classic pilsner strain from Czech Republic. Dry with a malty finish.

YEAST.NAME: 1007 German Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Ales, Alts, Kolsch, Dry Stout
YEAST.NOTES: Crisp, dry finish with a mild flavor.

YEAST.NAME: WB-06 Safbrew Wheat
YEAST.NOTES: A specialty yeast for wheat beer fermentation. The yeast produces a subtle estery and phenlol flavor typical of wheat beers.

YEAST.NAME: 2178 Wyeast Lager Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of lager strains to produce a complex but clean lager flavor profile. Suitable for many common lager styles.

YEAST.NAME: WLP705 Sake Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: For use in rice based fermentations. For sake, use this yeast in conjunction with Koji (to produce fermentable sugar). WLP705 produces full body sake character, and subtle fragrance. Alcohol tolerance to 16%.

YEAST.NAME: WLP750 French Red Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Bordeaux yeast for red wine fermentations. Moderate fermentation characteristics. Tolerates lower fermentation temperatures. Rich, smooth flavor profile. Alcohol Tolerance: 17%.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0120 British Pale Ale #1
YEAST.NOTES: Bold, citrusy character which accentuates mineral and hop flavors. Distinct character of a classic Pale Ale.

YEAST.NAME: WLP840 American Lager Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All American Style Lagers -- both light and dark.
YEAST.NOTES: Dry and clean with very slight apple fruitiness. Minimal sulfer and diacetyl.

YEAST.NAME: WLP675 Malolactic Bacteria
YEAST.NOTES: Bacteria for use in secondary. Malolactic fermentation is the conversion of malic acid to lactic acid by bacteria from the lactic acid bacteria family. Lactic acid is less acidic than malic acid, which in turn decreases acidity and helps to soften.

YEAST.NAME: WLP028 Edinburgh Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Strong Scottish style ales, ESB, Irish Reds
YEAST.NOTES: Malty strong ale yeast. Reproduces complex, malty, flavorful schottish ales. Hop character comes through well.

YEAST.NAME: WLP003 German Ale II
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Kolsch, Alt and German Pale Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Strong sulfer component will reduce with aging. Clean flavor, but with more ester production than regular German Ale Yeast.

YEAST.NAME: T-58 SafBrew Specialty Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Estery, somewhat spicy ale yeast. Solid yeast formation at end of fermentation. Widely used for bottle and cask conditioning.

YEAST.NAME: WLP039 Nottingham Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British ales, pale ales, ambers, porters and stouts.
YEAST.NOTES: British style of ale yeast with a very dry finish and high attenuation. Medium to low fruit and fusel alcohol production. Good top fermenting yeast for cropping.

YEAST.NAME: D-47 Lalvin
YEAST.BEST_FOR: White wines such as Chardonnay and Rose. Also good for mead.
YEAST.NOTES: Recommended for white variety wines such as Chardonnay and Rose as well as Mead. Low foaming, quick fermenting, forming a compact lees at the end of fermentation. Use yeast nutrients if making mead. Saccharomyces Cerevisiae.

YEAST.NAME: WLP830 German Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Marzen, Pilsner, Lagers, Oktoberfest beers.
YEAST.NOTES: Very malty and clean. One of the world's most popular lager yeasts.

YEAST.NAME: WLP005 British Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Excellent for all English style ales including bitters, pale ale, porters and brown ale.
YEAST.NOTES: This yeast has higher attenuation than the White Labs English Ale yeast strains. Produces a malty flavored beer.

YEAST.NAME: 1968 London ESB Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English Bitters, IPA, Brown Ales, Mild Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, balanced flavor. Fruity, rich finish. Excellent for cask conditioned ales and bitters.

YEAST.NAME: 1099 Whitbread Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Whitbread Ale, British Ales, Pales, Bitters
YEAST.NOTES: Slightly more fruity and malty than Wyeast's British Ale. Clear and highly flocculant.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0160 British Draft Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Full bodied, well rounded ale yeast with a touch of diacytl. Emphasizes malt character. Great for porters and bitters.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0930 German Weiss
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Weiss, Weizen, other Southern German Wheat styles
YEAST.NOTES: Milder than German Wheat #1, this strain still produces the desired clove and phenol character, but to a lesser degree. Full, earthy character.

YEAST.NAME: WLP655 Belgian Sour Mix 1
YEAST.NOTES: Note: Bacteria to use in secondary only. A unique blend perfect for Belgian style beers. Includes Brettanomyces, Saccharomyces, and the bacterial strains Lactobacillus and Pediococcus.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0400 Old German Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Altbier, German ales, some Wheat beers.
YEAST.NOTES: Traditional Alt Bier flavor. Strong fermenter with a smooth, attenuated, mild flavor. Slightly dry, clean, quenching finish.

YEAST.NAME: WLP080 Cream Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: A blend of ale and lager yeast strains that work together to create a clean, light American lager style ale. A pleasing estery aroma may be perceived. Hop flavors and bitterness are slightly subdued.

YEAST.NAME: WLP645 Brettanomyces Claussenii
YEAST.NOTES: Low intensity Brett character. Originally isolated from strong English stock beer, in the early 20th century. The Brett flavors produced are more subtle than WLP650 and WLP653. More aroma than flavor contribution. Fruity, pineapple like aroma.

YEAST.NAME: WLP026 Premium Bitter Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All English ales including bitters, milds, ESB, Porter, Stout and Barley Wine
YEAST.NOTES: From Staffordshire England. Mild, but complex estery flavor. High attenuation - ferments strong and dry. Suitable for high gravity beers.

YEAST.NAME: 2565 Kolsch Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Very malty flavor with mix of lager and ale character. Crisp, clean finish.

YEAST.NAME: 5733 Pediococcus
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria used in the production of Belgian style beers where additional acidity is desirable. Often found in gueuze and other Belgian style beer. Acid production will increase with storage time. It may also cause ropiness and produce low level.

YEAST.NAME: 3463 Forbidden Fruit
YEAST.NOTES: Phenolic profile with subdued fruitiness. Available seasonally.

YEAST.NAME: US-05 Safale American
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American ale, other clean finish ales
YEAST.NOTES: American ale yeast that produces well balanced beers with low diacetyl and a very clean, crisp end palate.

YEAST.NAME: WLP820 Octoberfest/Marzen Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Marzen, Oktoberfest, European Lagers, Bocks, Munich Helles
YEAST.NOTES: Produces a malty, bock style beer. Does not finish as dry or as fast as White's German Lager yeast. Longer lagering or starter recommended.

YEAST.NAME: WLP500 Trappist Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Trappist Ale, Dubbel, Trippel, Belgian Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Distinctive fruitiness and plum characteristics. Excellent for high gravity beers.

YEAST.NAME: 2035 American Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Bold, with a complex aroma. Good flavor depth characteristics for a wide variety of lager beers.

YEAST.NAME: WLP718 Avize Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Champagne isolate used for complexity in whites. Contributes elegance, especially in barrel fermented Chardonnays. Alcohol tolerance to 15%.

YEAST.NAME: 1010 American Wheat Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, Crisp, tart beer in the American Hefeweizen style. Low flocculation aids in producing desired chill haze.

YEAST.NAME: WLP029 German Ale/Kolsch
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Kolsch, Altbiers, Pale Ales, Blonde and Honey Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Great for light beers. Accentuates hop flavors. Slight sulfer flavor will fade with age and leave a clean, lager like ale.

YEAST.NAME: WLP833 German Bock Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bocks, Doppelbocks, Oktoberfest, Vienna, Helles, some American Pilsners
YEAST.NOTES: Produces beer that has balanced malt and hop character. From Southern Bavaria.

YEAST.NAME: WLP545 Belgian Strong Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian dark strongs, Abbey ales and Christmas beers
YEAST.NOTES: From the Ardennes region of Belgium, this classic strain produces moderate esters and spicy phenolic character. Results in a dry but balanced finish. Use for dark or strong abbey ales.

YEAST.NAME: 2112 California Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Suited for 19th century California style beers. Lagers at high temperature and produces malty, clear beers.

YEAST.NAME: 3112 Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Lambic, Gueze Lambic, and Sour Browns
YEAST.NOTES: Wild yeast strain isolated from Brussels region of Belgium. Adds classic sweaty horse hair flavor as well as sourness and cherry-pie like flavor. Generally used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae after the primary fermentation has begun.

YEAST.NAME: WLP380 Hefeweizen IV Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Large clove and phenolic aroma, but with minimal banana flavor. Citrus and apricot notes. Crisp and drinkable, with some sulfur production.

YEAST.NAME: WLP770 Suremain Burgundy Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Emphasizes fruit aromas in barrel fermentations. High nutrient requirement to avoid volatile acidity production. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%.

YEAST.NAME: 3944 Belgian Witbier
YEAST.NOTES: Tart, slightly phenolic character. For Wits and Grand Cru. Tolerates high gravity beers well.

YEAST.NAME: CL-5600 Pediococcus Damnosus
YEAST.NOTES: Slow growing bacteria used in secondary to create lactic acid flavor in Belgian lambics. Produces large amounts of lactic acid and diacytl. Prefers anaerobic conditions.

YEAST.NAME: K1V-1116 Lalvin
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Souvingnon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Seyval.
YEAST.NOTES: Used for white grape varieties. Rapid starter with constant and complete fermentation. Capable of surviving difficult conditions such as low nutrient or high SO2 levels. Has low volatile action.

YEAST.NAME: WLP510 Bastogne Belgian Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: High gravity beers, Belgian ales, Dubbels, Trippels.
YEAST.NOTES: High gravity Trappist ale yeast. Creates a dry beer with a slightly acidic finish. Cleaner finish and slightly less spicy than WLP500 or WLP530.

YEAST.NAME: 1272 GF All American Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Amber, Brown, IPA, Pale ales and stouts. Blondes and fruit beers.
YEAST.NOTES: Popular all purpose American ale style now in a Gluten Free strain. Produces beers that are nutty, clean with a slight tart finish. Ferment warmer to accentuate hops and add fruitiness or ferment cold for clean light citrus character.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0130 British Pale Ale #2
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British Pale Ale, other British Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Smooth, full bodied, well roundd ale yeast. Mild esters. Strong ferementer suitable for strong or spiced ales. Accentuates caramel and malt flavors.

YEAST.NAME: WLP400 Belgian Wit Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Phenolic and tart. The original yeast used to produce Wit in Belgium.

YEAST.NAME: WLP727 Steinberg-Geisenheim Wine
YEAST.NOTES: German origin wine yeast. High fruit/ester production. Moderate fermentation characteristics and cold tolerant.

YEAST.NAME: 1728 Scottish Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Scottish Ale, Scottish Strong Ales, Sweet Stout, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine
YEAST.NOTES: High alcohol tolerance.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0680 East European Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Smooth, rich, creamy character. Emphasizes big malt flavor and clean finish. Full but smooth malt character.

YEAST.NAME: WLP025 Southwold Ale
YEAST.NOTES: From Suffolk county. Products complex fruity and citrus flavors. Slight sulfer production, but this will fade with aging.

YEAST.NAME: WLP838 Southern German Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Pilsner, Helles, Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bocks
YEAST.NOTES: Malty finish and balanced aroma. Strong fermenter, slight sulfur and low diacetyl.

YEAST.NAME: WLP653 Brettanomyces Lambicus
YEAST.NOTES: Use in secondary. High intensity Brett character. Defines the "Brett character": Horsey, smoky and spicy flavors. As the name suggests, this strain is found most often in Lambic style beers, which are spontaneously fermented beers.

YEAST.NAME: 1272 American Ale II
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All American Ales, Brown Ales, Barley Wine
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, tart, nutty flavor. More fruity than Wyeast American Ale yeast.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0450 Kolsch
YEAST.NOTES: Produces mild sulfer flavor which smooths with time to a clean attenuated flavor. Mineral and malt characters come through well. Clean, lightly yeasty flavor and aroma in the finish.

YEAST.NAME: WLP410 Belgian Wit II
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit, Spiced Ale, Wheat Ales and Specialty Beers
YEAST.NOTES: Less phenolic than WLP400 (Belgian Wit Ale) but more spicy. Leaves a little more sweetness and flocculation is higher than WLP400.

YEAST.NAME: WLP940 Mexican Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Mexican style light and dark lagers.
YEAST.NOTES: From Mexico City - produces a clean lager beer with a crisp finish. Good for mexican style beers.

YEAST.NAME: S-23 SafLager West European Lager
YEAST.NOTES: German lager yeast strain. Performs well at low temperature. High flocculation and attenuation for a clean German finish.

YEAST.NAME: 1028 London Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English Ales, Bitters, IPAs, Brown Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry finish, bold, rich flavor, some fruit profile and a crisp finish.

YEAST.NAME: WLP735 French White Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Classic yeast for white wine fermentation. Slow to moderate fermenter and foam producer. Gives an enhanced creamy texture. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%.

YEAST.NAME: 1318 London Ale III
YEAST.NOTES: Light, fruity flavor. Balanced flavor with hint of sweetness.

YEAST.NAME: WLP730 Chardonnay White Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Dry wine yeast. Slight ester production, low sulfur dioxide production. Enhances varietal character. WLP730 is a good choice for all white and blush wines, including Chablis, Chenin Blanc, Semillon, and Sauvignon Blanc. Fermentation speed is moderate.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0150 British Real Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Great for real pub bitters. Has a complex, woody flavor and musty ester profile that characterizes real ale. Underattenuating to leave mild sweetness to the finish.

YEAST.NAME: WLP300 Hefeweizen Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German style wheat beers. Weiss, Weizen, Hefeweizen
YEAST.NOTES: Produces the banana and clove nose traditionally associated with German Wheat beers. Also produces desired cloudy look.

YEAST.NAME: WLP008 East Coast Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Ales, Golden ales, Blonde Ale, Pale Ale and German Alt styles
YEAST.NOTES: White labs "Brewer Patriot" strain can be used to reproduce many of the American versions of classic beer styles. Very clean with low esters.

YEAST.NAME: 3942 Belgian Wheat Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Estery lor phenol yeast. Plum and apple aroma with a dry finish.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0270 Australian Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Produces a malty, bready, nutty character with a pleasant honey like finish. This yeast emphasizes malt nuances and is very forgiving in warmer fermentations for those who cannot ferment under controlled conditions.

YEAST.NAME: 3333 German Wheat
YEAST.NOTES: Subtle flavor profile. Sharp, fruity, crisp, sherry like flavor.

YEAST.NAME: S-33 SafBrew Ale
YEAST.NOTES: General purpose ale yeast, widely used. Very consistent, clean finish. High attenuation and good flavor profile.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0600 Original Pilsner
YEAST.NOTES: Full bodied lager yeast with sweet, underattenuated finish. Subdued diacetyl character. Big malty palatte. Classic Pilsner finish and style.

YEAST.NAME: WLP810 San Francisco Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: California and Premium Lagers, all American Lagers
YEAST.NOTES: Produces "California Common" style beer.

YEAST.NAME: WLP575 Belgian Style Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of two trappist ale yeasts and one Belgian ale yeast. Creates a versatile blend to be used for Trappist and other Belgian style ales.

YEAST.NAME: WLP860 Munich Helles
YEAST.NOTES: Possible Augustiner Strain. This yeast helps to produce a malty, but balanced traditional Munich-style lager. Clean and strong fermenter, it's great for a variety of lager styles ranging from Helles to Rauchbier.

YEAST.NAME: WLP038 Manchester Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Top fermenting strain that is good for top-cropping. Moderately flocculent with a clean, dry finish. Low ester profile for producing a balanced English ale.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0380 Saison
YEAST.BEST_FOR: French or Belgian Ales and Grand Cru styles.
YEAST.NOTES: Pleasant yeast blend. Leaves a smooth full character to the malt with mild, but pleasant esters and some apple pie spices.

YEAST.NAME: 5526 Brettanomyces Lambucus
YEAST.NOTES: This is a wild yeast strain isolated from Belgian lambic beers. It produces a pie cherry-like flavor and sourness with a distinct Brett character. A pellicle may form in bottles or casks. This strain works best in conjunction with other yeasts.

YEAST.NAME: WLP011 European Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Alt, Kolsch, malty English Ales, Fruit beers
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, Northern European ale yeast. Low ester production, low sulfer, gives a clean profile. Low attenuation contributes to malty taste.

YEAST.NAME: WLP099 Super High Gravity Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Very high gravity beers and barley wine up to 25% alcohol.
YEAST.NOTES: Ferments up to 25% alcohol content. Flavor may vary greatly depending on beer alcohol. English like esters at low gravity, but will become more wine-like as alcohol exceeds 16% ABV. Refer to White Labs web page for tips on fermenting high gravity ales.

YEAST.NAME: 1335 British Ale II
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British and Canadian Ales, English Bitters
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, clean, crisp finish. Dry flavor.

YEAST.NAME: 2308 Munich Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Pilsners, Light Lagers, Dortmond/Export, Marzen/Oktoberfest, Dunkel
YEAST.NOTES: Unique Pilsner strain. Very smooth, well-rounded and full bodied. Benefits from a diacetyl rest.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0300 Belgian Ale #1
YEAST.NOTES: Produces classic Belgian ale flavor. Robust, estery with notes of clove and fruit. Ferments well in high gravity worts.

YEAST.NAME: 2206 Bavarian Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Bocks, Vienna, Oktoberfest, Hells, Marzens, Dunkel
YEAST.NOTES: Use by many German breweries. Produces a full-bodied, rich, malty beer.

YEAST.NAME: WLP036 Dusseldorf Alt Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Alt biers, Dusseldorf Alts, German Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Traditional alternative yeast from Dusseldorf, Germany. Produces clean, slightly sweet alt beers. Does not accentuate hop flavor like WLP029 does.

YEAST.NAME: 2007 Pilsen Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Pilsner, Bohemian Pilsner, Light Lagers
YEAST.NOTES: Classic American pilsner strain. Smooth with a malty flavor. Dry and crisp fermentation.

YEAST.NAME: EC-1118 Lalvin
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All types of wine and also cider.
YEAST.NOTES: Low production of foam, volatile acid and H2S. Ferments over a wide temperature range. High alcohol tolerance, compact lees and good flocculation. Relatively neutral flavor and aroma.

YEAST.NAME: 4733 Pediococcus Cerevisiae
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Creates a high level of lactic acidity over a long time. Often used with other yeasts, and it may take several months for flavor to fully develop.

YEAST.NAME: 1214 Belgian Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Abbey Ales, Trappist Ales
YEAST.NOTES: Trappist style ale yeast. Complex estery flavor.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0110 British Microbrewery Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Complex oakey, and fruity ester profile. Slightly under-attenuated finish leaves some residual malt flavor. Suitable for low to medium gravity bitters and ales.

YEAST.NAME: 3787 Trappist High Gravity
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit, Trappist Ale, High gravity ales
YEAST.NOTES: Robust top cropping yeast. Phenolic character and alcohol tolerance up to 12%. Rich ester profile and malty flavor.

YEAST.NAME: 3763 Roselare Belgian Blend
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sour brown and red beers.
YEAST.NOTES: Culture of Saccharomyces, Brettonomyces and Lactic Acid Bacteria. Complex aromas and flavors. May be used for primary fermentation. Primarily for sour brown and red Belgian styles.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0340 Belgian Ale #3
YEAST.NOTES: Slightly more refined than CL-300. Produces the classic Trappist ale character with esters of spice and fruit. Mildly phenolic. Strong fermenting yeast.

YEAST.NAME: WLP009 Australian Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: White Labs entry for Australian Ales. Produces a clean, malty finish with pleasant ester character. Bready character. Can ferment clean at high temperatures.

YEAST.NAME: WLP862 Cry Havoc
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All American Style Lagers -- both light and dark.
YEAST.NOTES: Licensed by White Labs from Charlie Papazian, author of "The Complete Joy of Home Brewing". This yeast was used to brew many of his original recipes. Diverse strain can ferment at ale and lager temps.

YEAST.NAME: 1084 Irish Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Irish Dry Stouts, Porter, Scottish Ale, Brown Ale, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine
YEAST.NOTES: Dry diacetyl, fruity flavor characteristic of stouts. Full bodied, dry, clean flavor.

YEAST.NAME: WLP004 Irish Ale Yeast
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Irish Ales, Stouts, Porters, Browns, Reds and Pale Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Excellent for Irish Stouts. Produces slight hint of diacetyl balanced by a light fruitiness and a slightly dry crispness.

YEAST.NAME: 2633 Octoberfest Lager Blend
YEAST.NOTES: This blend of lager strains is designed to produce a rich, malty, complex and full bodied Octoberfest style beer. It attenuates well while leaving plenty of malt character and mouthfeel. This strain is low in sulfur production.

YEAST.NAME: 5335 Lactobacillus
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from a Belgian brewery. This culture produces moderate levels of acidity and is commonly found in many types of beers including gueuze, lambics, sour brown ales and Berliner Weisse.

YEAST.NAME: 3724 Belgian Saison
YEAST.NOTES: Classic farmhouse ale yeast. Spicy, complex aromatics including bubble gum. Tart and dry on the palate with mild fruitiness. Finishes crisp and mildly acidic. Ferment at warm temperature. May have vigorous fermentation start.

YEAST.NAME: 5112 Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
YEAST.NOTES: This strain of wild yeast was isolated from brewery cultures in the Brussels region of Belgium. It produces the classic sweaty horse blanket character and may form a pellicle in bottles or casks.

YEAST.NAME: WLP530 Abbey Ale
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Trappist Ale, Spiced Ale, Trippel, Dubbel, Grand Cru
YEAST.NOTES: Used in two of six remaining Trappist breweries. Distinctive plum and fruitiness. Good for high gravity beers.

YEAST.NAME: CL-0060 North-Eastern Micro Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, bready, yet clean malt character. Leaves hops flavor and aroma intact. versatile yeast for many American styles.

YEAST.NAME: WLP720 Sweet Mead/Wine
YEAST.NOTES: Lower attenuation than White Labs Champagne Yeast. Leaves some residual sweetness as well as fruity flavor. Alcohol concentration up to 15%.

YEAST.NAME: 2247 European Lager II
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsner, American Pilsner, Helles, Dunkel
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, dry flavor profile for aggressively hopped pilsners. Dry finish, mild aroma, slight sulfur production.

YEAST.NAME: 2000 Budvar Lager
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsner, Classic Pilsners, Dortmunder and Light Lagers
YEAST.NOTES: Classic pilsner lager yeast. Malty nose and subtle fruit. Rich malt profile, but dry crisp finish. Hop character accentuated by dry finish.
